alert.note: Alert for Inland Brunswick (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 1:58PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Brunswick County through 230 PM EDT... At 158 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mill Creek, or 10 miles southwest of Leland. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Shallotte, Boiling Spring Lakes, Bishop, Mill Creek, Town Creek, Supply, Brunswick County Community College Main Campus, Winnabow, Bolivia and Brunswick Novant Medical Center. This includes US Route 17 in Brunswick County between mile markers 16 and 40. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
